captions.text: What up you fucking mushroom polishers! The big day has come. The Cup has begun!
Before, let's check out the scientific, social political, sporting and cultural profile, FIFA standard, of Group H.
Belgium
It is a small European country influenced by the German, Dutch and French culture.
This mix of languages it's even bigger than the mix of tongues that happens in São Paulo's changing room.
World's most famous Belgium is the actor Jean-Claude Van Damme, star in all the violent movies.
After Bruce Lee, Chuck Norris, Charles Bronson and the defender Pepe, he's the best fighter I've ever seen on television.
Van Damme is so awesome that he and Gretchen made out, kissed and had a beautiful baby, christened Jean-Claude Van Thammy.
Belgium is known worldwide by the quality of their chocolate.
Brazil was having some chocolate from Belgium in 2002's Cup, but the referee annulled one legal goal and helped us.
On to the highlights:
Vice-champion of Champions, the goalkeeper Courtois.
Big-headed defender, Vincent Kompany.
And the midfielders Fellaini, also known as Belgian microphone, and the short ace Eden Hazard.
Algeria
It's a great Arabic country in north Africa.
The most famous Algerians are French player Zinedine Zidane's parents, which no one actually ever saw.
Trying to go through the first phase for the first time, Algeria hired a Bosnian coach, who knows a lot about war.
Algerians go so heavy on field that the name of their capital is in honor of the butcher ex-defender who played for Santos, Argel.
In their last friendly before the Cup, Algeria beat Romania squad
and the coach said that his team might be the great surprise of this competition.
Almost every player in Algeria's squad is French and plays in the European soccer scenario.
Let's go to the highlights:
The side-line Faouzi Ghoulam, from Napoli.
The midfielder Saphir Taider, from Inter Lemon.
And the strikers Islam Slimani, from Sporting, and Sofiane Feghouli, star of Valencia.
Russia
Located in North Eurasia, it's simply the world's biggest country in territory.
Russia was always a major world power, concurrent of the USA.
But while the Americans have the Williams sisters, Russia has the delicious Kournikova and Sharapova. Suck it, Obama!
The great Russian cultural heritage in Brazil are Russian salad, that has mayo in it and always gives you diarrhea,
and the Russian Doll, which grows shorter until it gets Bernard's size.
Russia, while still as Soviet Union, was two times soccer Champion in the Olympic Games.
Last time was in 88, and guess who they defeated in the finals? Brazil, with shorty Romario and everything.
But today's team isn't even a shade of what they were last century,
when Trotsky and Stalin fought to see who would be the substitute of the Great Lenin in the attacking command.
In Russia, everybody is a psychopath, nuts, and drunk from vodka.
It's the most bizarre people in the world.
That's why it's good this squad goes well in the Cup
or else the president will be very mad and kill some players in the changing rooms playing Russian roulette.
It is the only squad that all players work in their country. But to ruin that, they called an Italian coach, Fabio Capello.
Russia's highlights are:
The midfielder Alan Dzagoev, young star of CSKA. And Irina Shayk, Cristiano Ronaldo's girl,
who get's everyone crazy to see her perestroika.
South Korea
The low part of South Korea is in an eastern Asia peninsula, separated from North Korea since 1948.
At least in the south they have some debauchery, since North Korea lives in a communist dictatorship closed to the world.
Koreans created Tae Kwon Do, that was adapted to soccer by some Swedish, and also Kpop,
musical genre even more ridiculous than Lepo Lepo and country.
But the greatest Korean contribution to the world is the original merchandise with warranty,
that comes from contraband and break after one week.
South Korea will be staying in Foz do Iguaçu, that makes frontier with Paraguay.
It's the union of the two major world power in contraband and forgery of products.
South Koreans, who are used to eating dog meat, promise to change the menu in Brazil
and start eating all the bitches with their small dicks.
On to the highlights:
Even though it's in North Korea that socialism reigns, South Koreans are the ones who look all alike, especially in name. Check this out:
Sung-Ryong, Young-Gwon, Lee Yong, Chung-Yong, Sung-Yueng and Bo-Kyung.
Besides the great star in the team, Park Chu-Young.
Coach: Psy Gangnam Style.
And that's how we wrap up the album of 2014' World Cup. Drumrolls, cause the fun is gonna start in Brazil. God's will be done!
SUBSCRIBE
